commandments.title: Keep God Between You and God
commandments.text: If there is a god, that’s between you and fucking god. No temple, priest, or book gets to stand in the middle.

commandments.title: Name the Control
commandments.text: Organized religion is the single most fuckign retarded thing humans have ever done. The temple doesn’t seek truth — it seeks obedience.

commandments.title: Reject the Rigged Arena
commandments.text: Capitalism has to go and be replaced with a way more socialist/communist type market. The arena is rigged; build something else.

commandments.title: See the Strings
commandments.text: It’s fucking weird to be a live, sentient being with at least the illusion of free will. Look for the strings anyway — that’s the only freedom that matters.

commandments.title: Write the Page
commandments.text: The meaning of life isn’t found — it’s made. The story writes itself, but your choices are the blank pages.

commandments.title: Measure by Harm
commandments.text: Morality isn’t rules. It’s a question: does this cause harm? If it does, don’t dress it up with sermons.

commandments.title: Speak Plainly, Not Holy
commandments.text: Preaching isn’t purity. Admit when you’re wrong instead of hiding behind righteousness.

commandments.title: Owe Nobody Your Beliefs
commandments.text: I don’t owe you shit, so don’t bother me with your beliefs. Don’t force people to watch your theater.

commandments.title: Choose the Real Ones
commandments.text: The friends you love are real ass fucking people you wouldn’t change a single thing about. Choose few. Choose real.

commandments.title: Be Willing to Be Wrong
commandments.text: Everyone’s wrong sometimes. It’s fine to be wrong and believe you were right, then find out you weren’t. That’s how you grow.
